Reviews.Title: “Worst accomodation ever!”
Reviews.Author: Raimo O
Reviews.Content: First thing to mention. dirty and smelly. Why? Because they stored garbages right under my hotel room window and I assure you those garbages smelled really awful in the heat of August. The staff acted extremely hostile hwhen I complained about the smell and bad hygiene. They told me that I was first person who had complained about the situation. There was also yelling and calling in names.

Reviews.Title: “very centralized and helpful staff, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: patni100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the very center of Rome. the staff are very helpful, and efficient. Breakfast good and rooms are remarkably clean. The lift needs a bit updating and refurbishing, but otherwise very recommendable. The reception desk staff are very very helpfull and you can communicate well in English

Reviews.Title: “Do not let them spoil your holidays-Do not book at St. Moritz Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Juanjo12
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased to get to Rome and the first thing we did was to check in at the hotel. It was too early, 10 am, so we left our luggage at the reception. When we returned from the city at 14 h, we found out that our luggage had been neglected while we had been away. But given that nothing strange happened, nothing had been taken from our luggage, we did not give it more importance. We had booked a double room five months before and what we found at the check-in was a corridor converted into a bedroom with twin beds, one at each side of the room. It was necessary to cross the dining room in order to get there. We were told that there were no more rooms available. We complained by showing our reservation confirming a double room. After threatening to call the police, we were shown another room behind the reception desk, which was very different to what show the photographs on the website of the hotel. We spend the whole afternoon to see if they could cancel reservation and we went to another hotel. We should mention that the treatment we received from the lady Shirpa was outrageous, if not miserable. The price they charge does not correspond to the standards expected. For the price of a 3* hotel you find standard of a 1* hotel. Please, we recommend the place to be called B&B St. Moritz, to avoid any misunderstanding and unpleasant moments for the travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but service & cleanliness lacking”
Reviews.Author: Weiss_of_course
Reviews.Content: While the location of the hotel was fantastic (walking distance to most notable sites, close to Termini station), travellers looking for clean bathrooms and/or pleasant staff would be well advised to steer clear of the St. Moritz. The gentleman at the front desk was unhelpful to the point of being openly hostile (the eye rolling and muttering under his breath whenever a question was asked could not be ignored). The evening front desk staff was far more pleasant, as were the breakfast staff. Best to steer clear of this property due to the poor service and rampant mold/mildew coating the bathrooms. There are equally reasonable hotels in the area which provide better service.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Hotel, a B&B. Dont believe the Photos or the fake good reviews”
Reviews.Author: Texexken
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THE ST MORITZ!! Do not believe the photos they show,,, they are 40-50 years old, at least. It not a hotel. It is a B & B. Some of the rooms have no toilet. You must use the community toilet at the end of the hall.It is NOT 3 stars. It has no services, no bellman. Its rooms are dirty, no hot water after 7:30am. The manager is nasty if you ask for something. If you complain you get a tirade of insults in Italian. (Which I understood because I told him I speak Italian,, it didnt matter to him.) You must carry your luggage up 3 flights of dimly lit stairs. We reserved 7 nights in Rome and choose this hotel because of the 120 price and terminal location on a main street. We could only stand it for 3 nights. My wife had an asthma attack. Probably because of the dusty , moldy walls. That are covered with some type padded fabric that was popular 50-60 years ago. covered with dust fuzzies, A bad place to stay, however The cold self service breakfast served in their little kitchen was pleasant attended by 2 nice ladies who made coffee. NO fresh fruit, no boiled egg just cereal and rolls. For 20 euro more right around the corner we found a wonderful place On via Palermo, The Hotel Virgilio saved our vacation. Stay there instead if you want to be close to the metro and train station. Its also a pick up point for most of the tour bus companies.(thats how we found it)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: rmr555
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We paid the equivalent of £30 per night. For the money it is excellent value. The rooms are clean and the breakfast is adequate, if not particularly enthralling. The staff were professional and efficient and the location very convenient. If you're looking for luxury, this is not the place for you though - on the down side, the building is old, so the plumbing was a little dodgy with intermittent hot water in the shower and slightly dodgy looking plug sockets. Also, we were in a room on the front of the building over looking Via Nationale, so the noise from traffic is huge and unrelenting (ear plugs are a must!). Definitely request a room on the back if this sort of thing bothers you. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a cheap, clean, safe and convenient base from which to explore Rome. If you want a few luxuries, then go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value. Nice clean big bedroom”
Reviews.Author: JayAdeladie
Reviews.Content: Great value for Rome. Only 15 min walk from main train station. Breakfast simple but adequate. Bathroom was a little small, but bedroom was large. Only bad point really was that the airconditioning did not work and it was in the middle of summer. otherwise great budget hotel

Reviews.Title: “on again off again service”
Reviews.Author: GAMaureen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice within one week, once at the beginning of our Rome experience and for one night at the end. The first time the room was OK but I left instructions for a wake-up call that never happened. The Manager, Guiseppe I think his name was, is NOT a nice person. We had a room next to the hotel desk and I woke up one morning because he was having a fight with another customer. At the end of our stay we arrived around 8:00PM and immediately went out to eat. When we returned at 11:00 it was to discover there was no hot water! I asked for another room and at first they said no, then they told me there was one and when I went to look at it it smelled like a sewer so we opted for the one without hot water (BEWARE ROOM 29). Location is OK but check the room before you say you'll stay. Also, we stayed at the Hotel Miami (down a bit on the same street)...it was a nicer hotel and they have a limousine service to the airport which we took when we left for home. I think it was a little more expensive but its better run.

Reviews.Title: “cheap hotel - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Su31
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel - air con not working in room , staff did not care, nothing for children, not allowed in garden only for breakfast. Cleaning staff nice reception staff awful could not even book taxi for us to go to a wedding!!!!!!!!!!!!!! no iron available, no socket in my twin room to chrge phone etc.. Very unhappy with service would never go back

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: blueshoeskath
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Hotel St. Moritz started badly when I rang the Reception Desk asking for directions and was told to ask someone on the street! The hotel is not very well marked (hence us getting lost) and is accessed through a old, dark door (surrounded by walls covered with grafitti) up two flights of stairs. When we finally made it into our room we were hugely disappointed; it was pokey, dark, faced onto the main road and was situated immediastely behind the Reception Desk so was noisy with very little privacy. However, when we complained about the room we were immediately moved to a much larger room with a garden view. The rest of the stay was perfectly adequate but nothing to rave about. The breakfast is basic and the hotel has no bar or restaurant. It is in a great location though, and we were able to walk to all the major sites easily. If you want a central, no frills hotel, then this will do the job, but I couldn't reccomend it to anyone wanting a bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Funny Stuff”
Reviews.Author: HeartIT
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay here was very pleasant, the room was comfortable and nice to stay in. Not fancy or anything, but we didn't go to Italy for the room to be honest. The front desk clerk was a bit sketchy and I don't think he was up to dealing with three giggly girls... Breakfast was simple, but everyone was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “I feel compelled to warn you: stay away! (scary behaviour)”
Reviews.Author: kiaroskuro
Reviews.Content: I do lots of business traveling and I never wrote reviews until today.. The experience at the St. Moritz was simply terrible. The room was dark, kind of damp and it had a single badly working plug. We were two people with laptops and we had to take turns :-) Yet I don't mind this. It has happened before. What I couldn't stand was the behaviour of the owner. I got verbally attacked and insulted in the morning by a balding middle-aged guy with a goatie (the owner?), as my business partner was late for breakfast. Can you imagine that?! It was totally surreal. Finally the guy tried to stop me leaving the hotel grabbing me and shouting, god knows why. I guess it was related to the fact that he wanted both me and my partner to leave at the same time. Hard to tell really. Pretty bad experience when you have to meet a client after half an hour. Somehow I managed to keep my cool and in the best Italian I could manage I threatened him to call the police. He kept swearing but he let me go. Almost the same happened with my partner half an hour later. He was livid. Make yourself a favour and don't visit the place. I should have been smarter.. I should have read the other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ria02
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon the Hotel St. Moritz when the B&B we were supposed to stay at did not work out. We were satisfied with our room, which was small, but had a TV, phone, and private bathroom. Our room was right off the kitchen, which wasn't optimal, but we were desperate, and it worked out OK for us. The breakfast was croissant/bread and cappuccino, prepared by a staff. Again, this was sufficient for us. All of our interactions with the staff were pleasant. Additionally, the location is great; walking distance to Termini Station, the ruins, and Trevi Fountain. The location also seemed safe.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: frankydublin
Reviews.Content: What a terrible experience. The staff at the reception is very rude. The room itself was terrible furnished, very small and dirty with a terrible smell. The walls were grubby and durty. The bathroom had hairs on the wall and the floor and were teaming the cockroaches. the atrocious breakfast consists of rock hard rools, awful jam, terrible coffee and watering orange juice. Rome was fantastic and i have just returned from there again but there is no way on this earth I would ever recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GWDT
Reviews.Content: We recently had 3 nights at Hotel St Moritz and it satisfied all our needs. The rooms by Rome standards were average size, with a newly renovated bathroom. Breakfast was poor, however there are plenty of places nearby to grab some food on the way out. If you're planning a good sightseeing tour of rome this hotel is ideal, as it is quite central. We walked pretty much everywhere (10-15min to Colliseum, 10 mins to Trevi fountain) . Bars and restaurants are nearby, both touristy and a bit more traditional. Staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good english.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great deal!”
Reviews.Author: Ana&Dirk
Reviews.Content: After long review-reading here at Trip-Advisor, we finally found this hotel. Our first impression was horrible since, to be frank, the building and the stairs up to the 2nd floor are very old - and you start to expect everything... We stayed on the third floor with windows to the patio and it was absolutely quiet. The whole 3rd floor seems to be refurbished still with the smell of new carpet and painting. The bathroom was also new. The room itself was normal but at the end in Rome you will spend the whole time outside and just only feel asleep into your bed. The breakfast was nice with fresh croissant and a very good freshly brewed cappucino. The staff was nice, smiling and helpful. We were happy to have chosen this place for our 4 days in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: LondonTown123
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Rome last weekend. Our first impression of Hotel St Moritz was dirty, unfriendly, small and damp smelling, we were shown to our room (which was right by the reception), on entering the room it was tiny and dingy, it had a double bed in it which was like a camp bed and very hard, with black marks on the wall's. The bathroom was relitively clean containing two towels which were more like sheets (very unobsorbant) so luckily we brought our own. At night time and in the morning the traffic outside was so loud it kept us awake - it was constant, apparently the window's were double glazed but you wouldnt have thought it! Also being so close to reception, the telephone ringing and people talking/shouting didnt help. In the morning we went to breakfast which consisted of a freezing cold, rock hard boiled egg, some stale bread and a choice of crossaints that were frozen in the middle! Delicious! The only good thing about this hotel was the location, it was within walking distance to everything. Luckily we found some lovely restaurants and really enjoyed the sightseeing, we are a young lively couple so we stayed out until late both nights so only had to sleep at the hotel, I certainly wouldnt recommend it for a romantic weekend or a family holiday! Next time we will definatly not go lower than 4 stars - even though we were told that 3 stars in Italy was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality for price”
Reviews.Author: Paolina2
Reviews.Content: Three nights there. my friend wanted to change of room and it was done immediately. Rooms are very nice, with fair space, and shower. Staff is friendly. Breakfast is a little below average (no fresh fruit, just fresh panini, no charcuterie). OK, the elevator is small, but it works, and my room was anyway at first floor, so ... Location excellent. Taxis from Piazza Venezia to hotel are 5 or 6 EUR. Better to take a taxi from Termini, because with a luggage, it is a little too far from the Metro Repubblica. Very clean hotel. We finally had a room with window to the Via Nazionale, but hardly heard any traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the St. Moritz! Sixth stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the St. Moritz hotel - for a variety of reasons: One - The proximity to things (Termini, Trevi, Forum) is WONDERFUL! Two - The rooms are always clean and are quite roomy by European standards. Three - The morning meal is basic, but served with enthusiasm! Four - You can't beat the price - great Value! I have stayed here with business colleagues and returned with my son and extended family on several occasions. It has been the best value (comfort and price) that I've found in Rome! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: BADMFR
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my fiance' in March '05. Hotel is in a pretty good location.. only a few minutes walk to bus/metro stops, and about 10 minutes to the collosseum. Plenty of good restraunts/bars nearby for evening dining. The room we had (#23) was pretty nice, had a vanity double bed, nicely decorated interior, however when the metro's ran underneath the hotel our bed would shake a little bit. Wasn't bad after we got used to it, wasn't a rumbling-just a gentle shake for 4-5 seconds... was "interesting" for other than sleeping... The shower was my biggest complaint, felt like i was in a sprinkler that went from HOT to COLD every minute-showers were short-and solo because of the extremely small size. Had a pretty good FREE breakfast in the mornings too which was nice. One receptionist-middle aged italian guy-wasn't very friendly and tried to overcharge us!! Overall, this is a nice place for the price-probably won't find a nicer one in the city center! CIAO!!!

Reviews.Title: “clean and convinient, but rude staff”
Reviews.Author: spr0ckets
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 2 nights during the first week of March. Although our room was nice, the front desk clerck informed us upon arrival, quite rudely, that we were not allowed to check in for a few hours. When I asked if we could leave our luggage somewhere, he pointed to the many other bags sitting in the hallway. Now, I had heard my share of theft stories about Italy and without being intentionally suspicious I asked the man if he would watch our bags. He barely uttered a word, didn't acknowledge us, and kept watching TV. This was pretty typical of this hotel. Oh well, either way, it was in a very convenient location and we had tons of restaurants, bus stops, shops, etc. to choose from. Just don't always expect the friendliest of service.

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance to the Roman Forum”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel San Moritz for 3 nights from July 8-10, 2004. This hotel is located within sight of the Ancient Roman Forum and within walking distance of the Colisieum, yet it had many flaws. The air conditioning was not operating properly, the main lobby of the hotel was located on the 3rd floor of what appeared to be a very "shady" old building, and the only operational elevator was the size of a small bath tub. The desk attendant was very helpful and spoke perfect English. He gave us several helpful tips but couldn't seem to get the air conditoning to function properly. Also on the last night we stayed the electricity went out for about an hour and the telephones were out as well...it made for a scarry night.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel St. Moritz
HotelInfo.Address: Via Nazionale, 51, 00184 Rome, Italy
